pageContext.claim: “And the drug companies are spending millions of dollars taking ads about me. And just remember, every time you see an ad about drugs and drug companies paying for it, that means one thing, it means that your drug prices are coming down at a level that nobody ever thought possible.”
pageContext.analysis: Through the middle of 2020, pharmaceutical manufacturers spent $87 million on lobbying, according to the Center for Responsive Politics. Not all of that was spent on ads, and certainly not all of that was in opposition to Trump's most-favored nation policy. So this is a clear exaggeration.
